sharing_roles: Killer for any of players. There are a little of his words.

Author's words: Ramon woked up. He had understood that he was being in water. So he felt something very strange and unbelieveable. It was the fact that Ramon breathed water. He has never done and could do it before in his life. How did he do it in this time he did not understand. Soon he noticed that there is something like big drifts swimming out from his back and when he had swayed with bottom part of his body he saw something like a tail of a mermaid instead of the bottom half of his body which he had ever had. Ramon was feared. He remembered that he had fallen in the aquarium, but he could understand nothing of what could happen at the time when he had woken up. Soon he had seen somebody like mermaid and with big transparent wigs swimming towards to him from the front side. This mermaid was like a Barbie: long white queue of blonde hair, big roll blue eyes and gentle pink lips. The mermaid has big green transpicuous wigs like Ramon's ones. She was swimming moving her hands, tail and wigs. So Ramon was terribled more to see himself in water not like he had accustomed to see himself and this strange creature in front of him. He shook. Mermaid swam closer to him. After that she began getting up and Ramon had felt that he was getting up despite nobody and nothing was not touching him. Just Ramon and the mermaid emerged from the water and flew over it the mermaid began speaking not loudly.

Beatrix: Nice to meet you, sir. I am very sorry for what happened. I beg you to keep calm. I can explain you anything what makes you to carry about, but I ask you to keep calm.

Author's words: After these words the mermaid and Ramon flew behind a wall of the place where they got down. At this moment Ramon's bottom half of body was turned into what it has always been before this surprising event. The mermaid was turned in a female human. Here Ramon began speaking not very loudly, but nerviously.

Ramon: I can understand nothing including if am I crazy or not!

Beatrix: So you have listen to me and to be patient. I am ready to answer many your questions.

Ramon: At first I don't understand who are you and even who am I.

Beatrix: Now you are the person whom you have ever been. You are not a mermaid or some marine inhabitant longer. You may not feel tumult about who you are now. I am spying after these people to lead scrutiny regarding their strategies and prevent tragic events from them in this city. I must confess these people are really not adequate. I don't have friendly relationship with these wacky people. I am here because I am spying after them. I am prompted to do it. I need certain information about these people.

Author's words: At this moment Ramon had gotten one moment of his life in his memory. It was how he had once upon a time seen a picture with likeness very similar to the likeness of this hero who was near him at this surprising moment of his life. Ramon recognized the likeness of the famous, but suspiciously existing hero of the city. So his mood was ameliorated. Ramon was inspired to see this hero and know that exactly this hero is whom was right in front of him in this strange and obscuring episode of Ramon's life.

Ramon: You are this superhero! It is cool. More precisely it would be cool if I did not have this misunderstanding in my life now.

Beatrix: The situation is that you have been appeared in the company of the mentally inadequate people. Sometimes this happens in the life. However unbeleiveable and breathtaking it was it is a real case at least. Now I have to protect you from these perilous murderers and so we have to be enough quite here. So you have to accept anything what I am telling you if you want to remain alive. I assure you it is not a frivolous joke. It is not a kiddy adventure game. Nothing like this and common with this. Absolutely nothing. I can swear lives of both of us. So, are you ready to hear me?

Ramon: I will be always ready to hear you. I am intrigued very much whether are you going to beleive me or not. I would be very glad to meet you if there was no such fear event like I am tried to be killed by some wacky idiots. There is strong assuring opinion that you don't exist in reality.

Beatrix: Mr, lets talk about it someday after this moment. It is very useful that people are not sure in my existance, but now we must talk about completely other thing. I insist you to hear and insight into my words right now.

Ramon: Alright. I will try.

Beatrix: So you are listening me and not being averted to some completely other questions. These people are not usual reasonable persons like you may be though about them. If you did you were wrong. But now you have to be as quite as you can. No loud crying, no panic, no cheers if you want to live. I am going to continue spying after these people and you are staying here. No a step from the place where you are staying right now! Is that clear for you?

Ramon: Are you leaving me for a long time?

Beatrix: You will be here along as long as you need to be occult from the eyes of the members of the company. I think it will be better for you to hide under this shed. Stamp, please.

Ramon: ddI don't know what is your name. Moreover I don't know even your heroic nickname. What is it? Share with me, please.

Beatrix: It is not your carry right now. I don't know niether your name, nor your nickname, but I don't care about it. I am carrying about your safety which means my success in my current deal. So I am ordering you to pull under the canopy right now!

Ramon: All right. I am doing.

Author's words: Ramon turned and went under the shed. When he had come he stopped and turned in the side of the hero who began passing towards to him. When the hero had appeared near Ramon, she began speaking again.

Beatrix: Now no a step from this place until I will be in front of you! Do you understand me current time?

Ramon: Of course, I do.

Beatrix: At this moment our conversation is being interrupted and you are staying here without only sound from your side! I am going to comply what I have to comply.

Author's words: The hero turned and left Ramon along. She went behind bushes in front of the gate. The hero listened steps from the front side. She has a guesswork that it was something related to the evil. The hero saw a man oppening the gate and entering in the court. The man held an axe and a big knife in a cover attached to his belt. The man passed closer to the bushes behind which the hero was sitting and looking at him through the leaves. So he saw that his friends were laying on the floor. It was not understandable whether they were alive or dead. He was dumbfounded from this view. He did not expect to see them laying motionlessly. He had been looking at his friends for not a long time before the hero jumped up from the bushes and appeared in front of him. So the man sharply switched the direction of his looking at her.

Killer: Who are you and what are you doing here? How did you dare to invade onto this territory!?

Beatrix: I'll explain anything what you need to know. So you may not worry.

Killer: I am ready to listen right now.

Beatrix: I am here to clear human lifes from misadventures. People don't need and don't want their life to be mangledby murderers like you! They are not commited to be killed and also they are not commited to be tormented by loosing their close people who are dear to them! That's why I am forced to presence here among the representatives of lower society like you and your friends!

Author's words: The killer thought this was somebody crazy with whom he talked. He did not guess this was a natural superhero who can cope with any murderer though Beatrix uttered her words very confidently and he saw that there was something very unpleasant regarding his friends and apparently they were mangledby this girl. The man saw nobody in good form except himself and this girl. The man and the girl run towards each other. The man stopped near the girl and swung with his axe at her efforting all his forces, but at this moment the girl had caught his hands and pinched it firmly. She hit the arm of the man with her leg. Right after this moment she hit his lips with her leg. The heroe's foe fell on the ground with mangled rutted mouse and hand and the axe fell off from his hand on the ground near him. The girl got down her leg, leand with squatting, took the axe, straightened and threw the axe off far. Meanwhile the man touched his rutted by the hit mouse. The girl stepped off from him and the man wiped blood from his face and got up from the land. Just he had done it the girl looked at him. He tooked the knife from his belt and swung at the girl with it. The girl caught his hand and right after that hit his nose and lips with the fist of her other hand. The man howled from pain. Then the girl hit him with her fist the second time in a 2 seconds so he did not caught even to think how to escape his hand off from her hand or hit her. The man howled louder from the second hit. At least the girl hit his lips the third time and he toppled on the ground with properly rutted nose and bleeded bottom half of face and dropped his knife. The knife fell near his legs. The girl came to him from the side of his head and pushed her leg on his neck. He tried to move her leg from his neck, but he was not successfull. So he was put in a hard state.
Hero put her leg off of the neck of this criminal and went to Ramon. After that this hero returned to Ramon's look.

Beatrix: Now I've done anything what I had to do.

Ramon: It is splendid. I am glad to hear it from you. But I would like to be concerned about one question. May I ask you what did you do a moment ago when you were not near me?

Beatrix: I made right order in this atmosphere. In this wild misunderstandable place is more precisely.

Ramon: Where are all these psychopaths?

Beatrix: They are not dangerous longer because they are in hard state and cannot move well.

Ramon: Are you serious?

Beatrix: These questions are such questions that I have nothing to keep in a secret from you.

Ramon: That's just a splendid thing that I can trust my hero! May I make a step from there?

Beatrix: Yes, you may.

Author's words: Ramon went off from the shed and went closer to the hero.

Ramon: As I understand you have annihilate these beasts and so you made order in the atmosphere! It is wonderful! How about the hydrosphere?

Beatrix: What do you mean?

Ramon: Of course, I mean this pool or maybe it is a gygantic legendary puddle where you and me met?

Beatrix: These murderers don't hobnob in water. They are usual people, not mermaids or some other marine creatures. But, a bit other thing is that they are not absolutely usual people, they are killers. It is not what a usual human means.

Ramon: I am so thankfull to your for saving my life and pulling me out of this unpleasantness! Thank you very much, my hero! I beleived in your existance and here I have personal meeting with you! But I would like to find out why they attempted on my life. Frankly I am very feared by this event. I perceive that I was wanted to be killed.

Beatrix: Now anything is fixed. If you want to know why it has happenned we don't have to part right now. We will take scrutiny regarding this question together, but main role will be mine.

Ramon: When are we going to start?

Beatrix: At the very beginning I have to ask you a few very important questions regarding to your bonds with these people. Are you ready to listen the questions and answer them?

Ramon: Yes. Why not?

Beatrix: All right. Lets start. The first what I must know: what was your purpose to attend at this meeting?

Ramon: These people invited me at this meeting as friends. I thought they intended to have a friendly time with me in the company: to chat with me, share something interesting between me and them, and show me this place and court as friends. One moment they unexpectable became behaviour strange and glaringly. I was really negatively surprised. I did not guess that they were maniacs, but it was a real noncense. They gave me advice to stick artificial hair on my bald with the purpose to look better. Moreover, they asked me questions related to financial status of my family.

Beatrix: I think they did not attach importance to what would be your opinion about them. They thought that these were the last minutes of your life. I have the following question for you. How did you become acquainted with them?

Ramon: A woman whom I am married arranged our acquaintance. It was in a beach a few days ago. We both were in the beach and one moment these people came to us. There were 4 of them, the same persons which I met in this meeting here.

Beatrix: What did this woman tell you regarding this acquaintance?

Ramon: She told that she had good friends in her job and wanted me to become acquainted with them. She gave me some information about their life. Чем они занимаются. I remember I was a bit surprised how it might be possible that my woman has male friends. It was not pleasant for me.

Beatrix: Now we have to go to your house and after that you will have to do quietly what you have planned to do if you must be at home according to your plans.

Ramon: Ok. Now I am going home, but I would like to concern the question about our researching more particularly. I would like to ask you when and where are you going to start it? Besides I am interested how do you intend to do it?

Beatrix: If you want us to cope with this researching successfully you must permit me to go to your house and live somewhere here in image of a little mermaid. Do you have an acquarium?

Ramon: Yes, I do, but Tracey will not like such idea as to contain somebody like a mermaid with human intellect. May I be concerned why do you want to go to my flat with me?

Beatrix: We must to keep my precense in your house in secret from her and it does not depend of whether she wants contain a mermaid or does not. She must be a subject of our contemplation. We don't have other ways because she introduced you these people and anything what you know about them you got from her words and this acquaintance. What is her name?

Ramon: Molly. My name is Ramon. Right, lets go in my flat. We are going to go on my automobile.

Author's words: Ramon and Beatrix went out of the court through the gate and went further.

Ramon: I would like to know about you more. Do you have at least a superhero nickname?

Beatrix: Not yet. Sorry.

Ramon: It is a pity. Frankly I am not very glad to listen it.

Beatrix: It is not my first necessity to have a nickname and be famous under it. To watch out for certain bandits or somebody other who means evil for innocent people and take right decision in opportune moment - that is important in my deal.

Ramon: I thought every superhero must have a famous nickname for everybody who knows something about him or her. People, at least, majority of them, must be intrested how they can call the superhero who lives in their world. Besides they must be intrested in something else regarding to the hero.

Author's words: Then a little period of time followed while Ramon and Beatrix were keeping silence.

Ramon: Do you know what superhero means for people living in one city with this superhero?

Beatrix: I am not from Los Angeles.

Ramon: Are you going to leave this city forever soon?

Beatrix: I can't tell about it right now.

Ramon: Why?

Beatrix: I never know what waits me ahead of my current deal. Not only one certain city may be a place for implementation every my following task.

Ramon: How do you get your tasks at all? What is necessity to change a city?

Beatrix: Excuse me, but all these questions are out of our common with you deal. That's why I don't have to tell you as much as you ask me. Moreover, I don't have to tell usual people about me very much just as a special trained agent and a magic hero.

Ramon: By the way I have a question which is directly linked to the current situation. What is wrong with all these wacky people? Are they dead or not?

Beatrix: They are alive, but they are wounded and immobilized by hits of pieces of ice. I lived in the water pool of these people and conducted surveillance over them. So I knew about them enough. They are employable killers who were going to make you their current victim. At once you had been threwn in the pool I saw you and freeze its surface into thick ice layer.

Author's words: Beatrix was telling the continuating of the narrative by portraying the plot with gestures of the hands.

Beatrix: Part of the frozen surface was covered with an iron sheet. Anything of this was made through my magic power. I saw through the ice layer anything near the pool including all these people. The tv-box was casted onto the iron sheet. After that I turned you into a merman. One man took a shovel and tried to break the ice. One of little pieces bumped in his face and fell him. Soon other one of the maniacs brought a burning piece of a tree and began heating ice with it. A piece of ice was cut off from the ice surface after there had been a big fracture around it. This piece soared up with the iron sheet and the tv-box flew and bumped in the face of th man who threw the tv-box. Immediately thereafter the iron sheet knocked other 2 of the people.

Author's words: At this moment while Beatrix was speaking the last words of this her replic Ramon and Beatrix reached Ramon's car. Ramon openned its door and sat at the seat. He pressed buttons behind himself.

Ramon: Please, open the door behind me and sit.

Author's words: Beatrix performed the command and closed the door.

Beatrix: The piece of ice was splited and the other one of these people was bopped by its wreckage. So they are forceless. There is no more hazard for you from them. So you may calm down.

Ramon: It is enough impressive and curious! You are a real, natural, really srong and, moreover, talented hero! I am so proud of you when I have listened this fairy narrative about saving my life from the gang of the psychopaths! I see the fact that they are enfeebled because of these hits of the pieces of the ice means making them dangerless even when they are not died yet.

Author's words: Ramon changed his intonation from neutral to emotional and rapturous.

Ramon: Are you serious? Anything what you are telling me is so interesting and astounding!

Beatrix: Yes, mr, I am serious. What is your surname?

Ramon: My surname is Perkins. So?

Beatrix: I will call you mr Perkins.

Ramon: Great. Lets go.

Author's words: The automobile wound up and set sail.

Ramon: As far as I understand you don't have very much to tell me about yourself. It is a pity. I would like to know if you have at least something a little to tell me. Do you know, there are very much people in this city who are very interested who you are. Somebody of them don't beleive in your existance. But I did beleive that you are real. Now I see my opinion has been confirmed as true! Besides I am so thankful you for saving my life!

Beatrix: If you want me to tell you something about myself I'll tell you about my very important request. Please, mr Perkins, no a word Tracey about me. And also, please, don't tell somebody other that you were tried to kill and I saved your life.

Author's words: It was a very unpleasant abruptness for Ramon.

Ramon: Why not to tell her anything what has happened today in bright colours animating picture!? On the contrary I would like to share this bright staggering sensational event? I remember we have negotiated that your presence in our aquarium will be implicit from Molly. But seems to me our today acquaitance is a bit other thing.

Beatrix: Mr Perkins, now Tracey is an object of my contemplation. She is a suspisious person and so must know nothing about me as your saver in this extremal situation.

Ramon: But why you can not share some interesting information about yourself with me at least?

Beatrix: I told you earlier. It is not permissible and apposite for magic heroes like me to tell usual people about themselves. I would like you not to tell about me very much somebody whoever it was.

Ramon: You are so secret! I didn't assume you will be so secretive. It is a pity for me. But anyway I am so glad to meet you! Besides I express my gratitude to you so sincerely! Thank you very much for saving my life, my delightsome fantastic hero!

Author's words: Beatrix smiled hearing these words though Ramon did not see her lit with the smile face.

Beatrix: Do you promise me to keep the fact about our meeting in secret?

Ramon: Of course I will respect your interests. I was really daunted when I had perceived that I had not been killed because of some very unusual and wonderful reasons. If there were not you I would be dead now. My awareness regarding this fact costs me so much agitation! But at the same time the fact about my personal meeting with you! This fact in my awareness is my motive for striking sensation like the fact that I could be dead now, but when one of these facts is with the minus sign, the other is something also striking but with the plus sign!

Author's words: Ramon was not asking his hero about something during a little period of time. He was just driving, keeping silence and looking in front of him through the glass.

Ramon's thoughts: Is it really happening!? But it is so unbeleivable that now I have met a great astounding magic and fantastick hero and now this hero is sitting in my car!

Ramon: You know, I want to say you that I would like boast my friends about my acquaintance with you with so much joy! But I know I am propeled not to afford to do it.

Author's words: There was another one time interval while Ramon and Beatrix were keeping silence. One moment Ramon began feeling his interest to another one question regarding this hero. Almost at once he felt that he could tell her something other very opportune speaking about what he might allude to the hero's need to be enough mystery for people. It was his thought about the fact that this hero figured in news. Some a very little time later Ramon began speaking with this hero again.

Ramon: You know, my hero, I must tell you that sometimes you are popular in the news via television and papers.

Beatrix: I know.

Ramon: Is it not incompatible with your rules to be in secret as much as you would like to be?

Beatrix: No. My existance is not a secret at all, but who I am and what promotes my extraordinary forces is not accepted to be revealed to the world.

Author's words: Ramon had thought a little regarding these words and soon he talked again.

Ramon: But I don't understand why you forbid me to tell somebody about my meeting with you if your existance is not a secret in itself?

Beatrix: The less information about me is known the better it is for me and my secret community.

Ramon: I have one very curious question about you. Can I ask you?

Beatrix: I don't know what question is this. So I don't know may you know the answer or not.

Author's words: Ramon sigh and prolonged his speech.

Ramon: I must confess you in something what may be not very pleasant for you as for me, but it is not regarding my current curious question to you.

Beatrix: What are these unpleasant news about?

Ramon: I feel driving is very hard for me now and It will be much better if I am not driving at this time. I guess I am not paying enough attention in this engagement. It is because I am emotionally excited now. My meeting with you is so sensational event in my life! It have summoned emotional storm in my mood and it is hurdle for me to be concentrated on the managing my vehicle. So now I feel I can't longer.

Author's words: Ramon stopped his car. He turned to Beatrix.

Ramon: Before we would bumped in something. It would not be merry. Can you sit on my place instead of me and take managment on yourself, please?

Beatrix: No, I can't. I am sorry, but it is true that I have never learned to do it.

Author's words: There was a gesture on Ramon's face as if Ramon was surprised.

Ramon: How is it possible? You, so amazing, clever and serious hero, cannot drive cars?

Beatrix: Did you hear somewhere that I must can drive cars or why do you think so?

Ramon: May I be interested how old are you?

Beatrix: I am eighteen. And what?

Ramon: Is it a real true that such clever, serious and beautiful yong lady as you can not such not very difficult thing as driving? Maybe even a superhero just can not exist without a disadvantage and that's why this specific has its place.

Beatrix: Mr Perkins, it is not a disadvantage at all. It is quite normal that mystery magic heroes can manage no kind of vehicles. Only usual people can need it, but not magic heroes like me. Heroes possess something completely other to move quickly. I am emphasizing that it is not too occult information about us, superheroes.

Ramon: Oh, now I understand and guess what it may be. So I am very sorry for my words about you. I mean the word "disadvantage" from me regarding to you.

Beatrix: I don't take offense at such little things.

Ramon: Perfect!

Beatrix: In the same time you may let me to sit in your vehicle with you of politeness when you and me hold direction somewhere together like in this case. It will not be redundant.

Ramon: Well, but another one fact is that I can't drive right now. Lets make a standstill. Are you not going to confront this idea?

Beatrix: Lets make.

Ramon: Well, good. My question is are your abilities innate or you got them once in your lifetime?

Beatrix: Frankly this information must be unexpressed. It crosses with one of main common for all the superheroes like me secrets.

Ramon: Oh! It is a pity! But what if getting such force is not incomprehensible for some people who are not heroes today and they can become them some day?

Beatrix: No, mr Perkins. It is not possible for everybody. I am sorry, but it this lamentable statement is guaranteed. I can not tell you how to became or to be born a hero like me. It alludes to the rules of heroes again.

Author's words: Ramon's eyes had been running around on the sides durring a very little time interval. After that Ramon began speaking again.

Ramon: Seems to me I can give you a superhero title. I hope you will not confront. I would like to give you such title as X-lady or X-babe similar to secret lady or secret babe. What will you say?

Beatrix: I think lady is more opportune than babe from you.

Ramon: Ok. I will call you X-lady. I hope you like this title.

Beatrix: But it is very possible that somebody of other people will want to give me some other nickname by their idea or somebody already have coined a nickname for me. Who else except you can know about my nickname X-lady if my meeting with you must be occult information?

Ramon: I will call you X-lady. You will be titled like this for me at all. Well, what may I talk to you about? Is there something what may be without prejudice to your mysteries and what I can be interested in?

Beatrix: We have stopped on the contemplation the surprising situation occured today with you. We want to find out the reason why these people tried to kill you.

Ramon: Oh, yes, of course. You have reminded me.

Beatrix: I can also remind you that we have the subject - Molly. At the first we must find out if she knows who are these people or not. At the second why she decided to arrange your acquaintance and meeting with these people and why she has become acquainted with them at all. So I will live in your acquarium and oversee her like these people.

Ramon: But you will not fit in our acquarium. It is not so big as those one where you and me met. Can you change your size?

Beatrix: Yes, I can.

Ramon: Really!?

Beatrix: Yeah.

Ramon: It is more startling!

Beatrix: More than what?

Ramon: Than I evaluated you while I did not know you can change your size. So now I see you are more striking than I thought! What an amazing novation you are! It is something unforgetable!

Beatrix: Thank you, mr Perkins. But I beg you to cry quiter. I don't want many of people to pay their attention on us.

Ramon: Ok. Can you tell me more about your plan regarding our contemplation?

Beatrix: It have to be a secret between you and me.

Ramon: So you have to sit near me on the front seat and we will talk as quite as we can hear each-other.

Author's words: Beatrix moved out from the car, came in it in front and sat on the front seat circa Ramon. At this moment Beatrix and Ramon began whispering.

Beatrix: You will ask Molly some questions and get answers. I will overhear and spy, watch her gestures and pay attention on them and her mood and intonation. So I have a possibility to find out her ideas and see true and false in her answers to interesting for us questions. Later I will profess to constitute all the facts and data in one - the whole storie about how this assult has occured.

Ramon: Yeah, anything of it is so interesting and curious! To say more - bewitching! I feel I will be in this excited mood for a long time. But in the same time I would not like to repose before I will be at home. I just don't know what shall I do. I can't take control over myself.

Author's words: It looked like Ramon immersed deeply in his thoughts. But he was keeping silence not too long before he began speaking again.

Ramon: No, I am not sure I can take control on myself. Can you think about your terrific magic power and suggest an idea what to do if we don't using management the vehicle for moving?

Beatrix: Yeah, of course. I am a telekinesis. I can lift your car up with you without touching it and enforce it to fly where you want.

Ramon: It is also so startling, so admirable! Lets apply your unbeleivable forces!

Beatrix: Than hold as stronger on to something as you can, please.

Ramon: I will, of course.

Author's words: Beatrix stepped out from the car and closed the door behind herself. Ramon clutched to his helm strongly. Staying near the automobile Beatrix looked at it. The vehicle was lifted up very quickly. It was continuing higher and higher slowly. Ramon felt his mood was excited more. He openned his mouth and did not know what to say emotionally at this time. Soon there appeared big brilliant wigs on Beatrix's back and Beatrix lifted up swaying her wigs. Soon she caught the automobile in the high. There was a crowd of people formed near around the place from which Beatrix and Ramon in his car flew up. Mostly there were yong people, but all the people in the crowd were startled to see this wonder. They had not accustomed to this phenomena as to something usually real by those moment. Many of them were staying freezing near the road.Ramon presented the hero the road and the sensational hero led the car with him according to the instruction.

Ramon: I have defined a nickname for you, my hero! It is not X-babe or X-lady now.

Beatrix: Really?

Ramon: Yeah. I wil call you X-marine because you are a specific unsearchable marine hero who can live in water and you will live in my acquarium in secret. I like this nickname!

Beatrix: Are you serious!?

Ramon: Yeah, my favourite hero! Of course!

Beatrix: I like it very much, too! Thank you, mr Perkins!

Ramon: I am glad that you like it!

Author's words: Ramon enjoyed flying in his car in the magic forces of the interesting startling hero. Beatrix smiled seeing that he felt joying in this process. Ramon got the thought that it must be true that to be a magic superhero is much cooler that to have a pretty splendid car.
